description.narrative: Kenya National Bureau of Statistics (KNBS) and Statistics Sweden have been cooperating since July 2014 (contribution 51110063). The present contribution extends the cooperation August 2019-July 2021 at a cost of SEK 19.48 million. The development objective is “Policy makers in the Kenyan society shall base their decisions on unbiased, reliable and high-quality information that helps them to design policies that contributes to a better environment, limited climate impact and strengthened resilience, a democratic development of society and improved opportunities for poor people to support themselves.” The project objective is “KNBS’ capacity to produce and disseminate statistics shall be improved.” The component objectives to be reached when the project ends are: *Management: KNBS shall improve production planning and declaration of statistical quality. *Economic statistics: the quality of economic statistics shall be improved in accordance with international standards. *Agriculture statistics: to improve the range of agricultural statistics/increase the number of agriculture indicators. *Gender statistics: to improve the range of gender statistics/increase the number of gender indicators. *Information and communication technology (ICT): ICT infrastructure in place that facilitates efficient production and dissemination of statistics. The primary activities and costs are short-term expert missions to Kenya, workshops, a long-term Swedish advisor, a local project administrator, and project management.

Kenya National Bureau of Statistics, KNBS, och Statistiska centralbyrån, SCB, har samarbetat sedan juli 2014 (insats 51110063). Nuvarande insatsen förlänger samarbetet augusti 2019-juli 2021 till en kostnad av 19,48 miljoner kronor. Utvecklingsmålet är att politiska beslutsfattare i det kenyanska samhället ska basera sina beslut på opartisk, tillförlitlig och högkvalitativ information som hjälper dem att utforma politik som bidrar till en bättre miljö, begränsad klimatpåverkan och förstärkt motståndskraft, en demokratisk samhällsutveckling och förbättrade möjligheter för fattiga människor att försörja sig själva. Projektmålet är att KNBS:s kapacitet att producera och sprida statistik ska förbättras. Komponentmålen som ska nås när projektet slutar är: * Styrning: KNBS ska förbättra produktionsplaneringen och deklarationen av statistisk kvalitet. * Ekonomisk statistik: Kvaliteten på den ekonomiska statistiken ska förbättras i enlighet med internationella standarder. * Jordbruksstatistik: Att förbättra bredden av jordbruksstatistik / öka antalet jordbruksindikatorer. * Genderstatistik: Att förbättra bredden av jämställdhetsstatistik / öka antalet genderindikatorer. * Informations- och kommunikationsteknik (IKT): IKT-infrastruktur på plats som underlättar effektiv produktion och spridning av statistik. De huvudsakliga aktiviteterna och kostnaderna är kortsiktiga expertuppdrag till Kenya, workshops, en långsiktig svensk rådgivare, en lokal projektadministratör och projektledning.

The development objective is “policy makers in the Kenyan society shall base their decisions on unbiased, reliable and qualitative information that helps them to design policies that contributes to a better environment, limited climate impact and strengthened resilience, a democratic development of society and improved opportunities for poor people to support themselves.” The project objective is “KNBS’ capacity to produce and disseminate statistics shall beimproved.” The objective of the management component is that KNBS shall improve production planning and declaration of statistical quality. The objective for the economic statistics component is that the quality of economic statistics shall be improved in accordance with international standards. The objective of the agriculture statistics component is to improve the range of agricultural statistics, meaning that the number of agriculture indicators should increase. The objective of the gender statistics component is to improve the range of gender statistics, meaning that the number of gender indicators should increase. The objective of the ICT component is that ICT infrastructure in place that facilitates efficient production and dissemination of statistics.

tag.narrative: 16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.

16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

title.narrative: Agreement Sida and KNBS Statistics development at KNBS
Agreement Sida and SCB Statistics development at KNBS
Agreement amendment Sida and SCB Statistics development at KNBS

description.narrative: Statistical management The establishment and implementation of a comprehensive register of statistical products is the foundation on which all planning stands. A new product register, publication calendar and planning system have been implemented at KNBS. This will support KNBS to become more efficient and capable as an organisation. Ever since two key staff members working with quality at KNBS left the organisation in the beginning of 2020, the project has struggled to conduct activities on the implementation of quality declarations. Discussions are therefore ongoing with several donors and KNBS on work with quality for the remainder of the project. Economic statistics The rebasing of the Kenyan National Accounts was successfully finalised with a very strong and consistent support from the project. The rebasing will significantly improve the quality of the Kenyan National Accounts. Rebasing for both Consumer Price Index and Producer Price Index was finalised during this period. This has significantly improved the quality of the indices. A new calculation model for the Producer Price Index was implemented. The model will improve the quality of the index as well as making the production process more efficient. Agricultural statistics Unfortunately, there has been very limited activity on the agriculture component during the reporting period. Just as for previous years, no resources have been made available to KNBS to carry out the National Seasonal Survey, which has been the sole aim of this cmponent. Time has run out for the project to effectively support KNBS with a seasonal survey. Focus therefore need to shift to another type of support for agriculture statistics, or in the worst case cancel the agriculture component. Gender statistics For this period, some limited remote support from Sweden have supported the production of a new, second version of the booklet Women and Men in Kenya. A lot of new data will be included, especially from the census, which will make it possible to produce much more comprehensive gender statistics. Due to Covid-19 and delays in the production of the census data, the project has not been able to give the amount of support originally planned. Information and Communication Technology Only limited support was given to KNBS for ICT during this period, partly due to Covid-19 but primarily because access to the ICT infrastructure at KNBS is limited to a very small number of people working with the census. This makes support for the ICT infrastructure at KNBS almost impossible. The focus for this period has therefore been on planning upcoming activities, and getting a better understanding of some of the fundamentals. Training for young statisticians The young statistician programme has continued for this period, alleviating some of the most pressing staffing issues. Eight of the young statisticians finished the programme in May and eight new statisticians (four women and four men) were in the process of being recruited to the programme. Source: SCB and KNBS, “Statistical Cooperation Project Between the Kenya National Bureau of Statistics (KNBS) and Statistics Sweden: Semi-Annual Progress Report April 2020 – October 2020” (2 November 2020)
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
